IMF announces appointment of Bo Li as Deputy Managing Director, effective August 23, 2021. With more than 14 years of service at the People’s Bank of #China, Mr. Li brings extensive experience in central banking and law. https://t.co/duNpd6MauL https://t.co/ybS5U901lG
Do you have questions about #Uganda’s new program with the IMF? Check out our FAQs page. https://t.co/C6H2KxNJuZ #IMFAfrica https://t.co/325PQNNsKJ
Uganda's economic program will support health and social spending and help preserve debt sustainability. Learn more here: https://t.co/VhRnEJHCa7 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/9ySf2n8XQg

Uganda has published an independent audit of COVID-19 spending and committed to other transparency measures.

Learn more about how the country’s new program with the IMF will support good governance and anti-corruption measures in Uganda. https://t.co/C6H2KxNJuZ #IMFAfrica https://t.co/9KtXemxH98

IMF’s Tao Zhang: Governance reforms are crucial to support transparency and private sector development. Uganda has made progress in publishing information on audits and the use of COVID-19 funds, and the country needs to do more work. https://t.co/VhRnEJHCa7 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/VUqaP6QEcZ

What are the goals of Uganda's new economic program, supported by the IMF?

1. Support pandemic response and recovery
2. Strengthen governance and transparency   
3. Preserve debt sustainability 

Learn more: https://t.co/C6H2KxNJuZ #IMFAfrica https://t.co/0RTHGLdb0e

The IMF Executive Board has approved a US$1 billion financing package for Uganda to support the COVID-19 response and recovery.

The program includes reforms to strengthen governance and transparency. #IMFAfrica

🇪🇬 #Egypt was one of the few countries that experienced positive economic growth in 2020. The IMF expects its economy to grow by 2.8% in FY2020/21 and by 5.2% in FY2021/22. Together with Egypt’s quick pandemic response, the IMF's support has helped maintain economic stability. https://t.co/MFaj7bTtUU

The growth of infections in sub-Saharan Africa is now the fastest in the world while vaccine rollout remains slow.
 
It is essential to deliver vaccines to the region as soon as possible, starting with a goal of 250 million by September. https://t.co/eMzyAEvxSK #IMFBlog https://t.co/K41Ma9Aalj

Sub-Saharan Africa is facing a third wave of COVID-19 infections that could be more brutal than previous ones. 

Without significant international assistance, the region will face repeated waves, paralyzing investment, productivity, and growth. https://t.co/eMzyAEN9hk #IMFBlog https://t.co/LFovVi7NmS
